title: Add clickable question navigator, resume practice position, and seed NEET syllabus chapters + year-wise PYQ (2025–2000)

requirements.text: Update the Practice page so students can jump to any question by clicking on a visible list/grid of question numbers (a question navigator), instead of only typing a number.

quotes: When some try to attemp question he or she can skip to any question by clicking on question number

acceptanceCriteria: On the practice screen, a question-number navigator is visible (e.g., 1..N) for the current (subject, chapter, category).
Clicking a question number immediately navigates to that question (updates the current question/slide).
The currently active question number is visually highlighted.
Question navigation is disabled or clearly indicated as limited while answer feedback is shown (to avoid accidental navigation), or navigation clears feedback state in a consistent way.

requirements.text: Ensure practice resume behavior reliably restores the student to the same question/slide they last viewed when they exit and later return to the same (subject, chapter, category), for both anonymous and authenticated users.

quotes: when student exit and after some time he tries to attain question he should be at same slide of questions where he left

acceptanceCriteria: Anonymous users: leaving the app and returning to the same practice route resumes at the last seen question index using localStorage persistence.
Authenticated users: leaving the app and returning to the same practice route resumes at the last seen question using backend practice progress.
After completing and submitting a test, stored progress for that (subject, chapter, category) is cleared so the next attempt starts from question 1.

requirements.text: Add support for year-wise PYQ organization for NEET PYQ and JEE PYQ questions from year 2025 down to 2000, including backend data modeling and frontend year selection before starting PYQ practice.

quotes: in neet jee pyq section put pyq by your own ... and question of neet jee should be year wise from 2025 to 2000

acceptanceCriteria: Backend stores a year value on PYQ questions (NEET PYQ and JEE PYQ), and existing questions remain readable after the change (defaulting the year field appropriately).
Frontend provides a year selection UI when the user selects NEET PYQ or JEE PYQ for a chapter (only if multiple years exist).
Selecting a year starts practice showing only PYQ questions for that selected year (within the chosen chapter and PYQ category).
The available years shown for selection are derived from actual question data and include years in the range 2025..2000 when present.

requirements.text: Populate the app with NEET-syllabus-based chapters for Physics, Chemistry, and Biology, and populate the NEET/JEE PYQ banks with year-tagged questions for years 2025–2000.

quotes: And add chapters in physcs chemistry and biology which in neet sylbuss by your own
and in neet jee pyq section put pyq by your own ... year wise from 2025 to 2000

acceptanceCriteria: The chapter list for each subject (Physics/Chemistry/Biology) is no longer empty on a fresh deployment and includes a reasonable NEET syllabus-aligned set of chapters with sequence values for deterministic ordering.
The system contains PYQ questions tagged with years covering 2025 down to 2000 for NEET PYQ and JEE PYQ categories (as provided by seeded data).
Seed logic is idempotent (running it multiple times does not create duplicate chapters/questions).
All seeded questions render correctly in practice mode (valid options A–D, correct option, and English explanation text present or empty-string but not null).

constraints: Use English for any user-facing text added or modified in the UI.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only introduce backend/migration.mo changes if required for state compatibility.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutablePaths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT; compose existing UI components instead.
Do not use external databases or third-party AI/LLM service integrations to fetch questions; all seeded content must be embedded/created within the app codebase.
nonGoals: Implementing third-party authentication providers (only Internet Identity is supported).
Adding real-time multiplayer or WebSocket-based features.
Building an admin CMS beyond the existing contributor/admin patterns (unless strictly required for seeding and viewing year-wise PYQs).
